description:
Traited class [tvb.simulator.models.epileptor_rs.EpileptorRestingState]

EpileptorRestingState is an extension of the phenomenological neural mass model of partial seizures Epileptor [Jirsaetal_2014], tuned to express regionally specific physiological oscillations in addition to the epileptiform discharges. This extension was made using the Generic 2-dimensional Oscillator model (parametrized close to a supercritical Hopf Bifurcation) [SanzLeonetal_2013] to reproduce the spontaneous local field potential-like signal.

This model, its motivation and derivation can be found in the published article [Courtioletal_2020].

Variables of interest to be used by monitors: p * (-x_{1} + x_{2}) + (1 - p) * x_{rs}

\begin{align*} \dot{x_{1}} &=& y_{1} - f_{1}(x_{1}, x_{2}) - z + I_{ext1} \\ \dot{y_{1}} &=& c - d x_{1}^{2} - y_{1} \\ \dot{z} &=& \begin{cases} r(4 (x_{1} - x_{0}) - z -0.1 z^{7}) & \text{if} x<0 \\ r(4 (x_{1} - x_{0}) - z) & \text{if} x \geq 0 \end{cases} \\ \dot{x_{2}} &=& -y_{2} + x_{2} - x_{2}^{3} + I_{ext2} + b_{2} g(x_{1}) - 0.3 (z-3.5) \\ \dot{y_{2}} &=& 1 / \tau (-y_{2} + f_{2}(x_{2}))\\ \dot{g} &=& -0.01 (g - 0.1 x_{1})\\ \dot{x_{rs}} &=& d_{rs} \tau_{rs} (-f_{rs} x_{rs}^3 + e_{rs} x_{rs}^2 + \alpha_{rs} y_{rs} + \gamma_{rs} I_{rs}) \\ \dot{y_{rs}} &=& d_{rs} (b_{rs} x_{rs} - \beta_{rs} y_{rs} + a_{rs}) / \tau_{rs} \end{align*}
where:
\begin{equation*} f_{1}(x_{1}, x_{2}) = \begin{cases} a x_{1}^{3} - b x_{1}^2 & \text{if } x_{1} <0\\ -(slope - x_{2} + 0.6(z-4)^2) x_{1} &\text{if }x_{1} \geq 0 \end{cases} \end{equation*}
and:
\begin{equation*} f_{2}(x_{2}) = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if } x_{2} <-0.25\\ a_{2}(x_{2} + 0.25) & \text{if } x_{2} \geq -0.25 \end{cases} \end{equation*}

Attributes declared

Coefficient of the cubic term in the first state-variable x1.

Coefficient of the squared term in the first state-variable x1.

Additive coefficient for the second state-variable y1, called :math:'y_{0}' in Jirsa et al. (2014).

Temporal scaling in the third state-variable z, called :math:'1/ au_{0}' in Jirsa et al. (2014).

Constant parameter to reproduce FHN dynamics where excitatory input currents are negative. Note: It scales both I_rs and the long-range coupling term.

arguments.a: Coefficient of the cubic term in the first state-variable x1.
arguments.b: Coefficient of the squared term in the first state-variable x1.
arguments.c: Additive coefficient for the second state-variable y1, called :math:'y_{0}' in Jirsa et al. (2014).
arguments.d: Coefficient of the squared term in the second state-variable y1.
arguments.r: Temporal scaling in the third state-variable z, called :math:'1/ au_{0}' in Jirsa et al. (2014).
arguments.s: Linear coefficient in the third state-variable z.
arguments.Iext: External input current to the first population (x1, y1).
arguments.slope: Linear coefficient in the first state-variable x1.
arguments.Iext2: External input current to the second population (x2, y2).
arguments.tau: Temporal scaling coefficient in the fifth state-variable y2.
arguments.aa: Linear coefficient in the fifth state-variable y2.
arguments.bb: Linear coefficient of lowpass excitatory coupling in the fourth state-variable x2.
arguments.Kvf: Coupling scaling on a very fast time scale.
arguments.Kf: Coupling scaling on a fast time scale.
arguments.Ks: Permittivity coupling, that is from the very fast time scale toward the slow time scale.
arguments.tau_rs: Temporal scaling coefficient in the third population (x_rs, y_rs).
arguments.I_rs: External input current to the third population (x_rs, y_rs).
arguments.a_rs: Vertical shift of the configurable nullcline in the state-variable y_rs.
arguments.b_rs: Linear coefficient of the state-variable y_rs.
arguments.d_rs: Temporal scaling of the whole third system (x_rs, y_rs).
arguments.e_rs: Coefficient of the squared term in the sixth state-variable x_rs.
arguments.f_rs: Coefficient of the cubic term in the sixth state-variable x_rs.
arguments.alpha_rs: Constant parameter to scale the rate of feedback from the slow variable y_rs to the fast variable x_rs.
arguments.beta_rs: Constant parameter to scale the rate of feedback from the slow variable y_rs to itself.
arguments.gamma_rs: Constant parameter to reproduce FHN dynamics where excitatory input currents are negative. Note: It scales both I_rs and the long-range coupling term.
arguments.K_rs: Coupling scaling on a fast time scale.
arguments.state_variable_range: Typical bounds on state-variables in EpileptorRestingState model.
arguments.variables_of_interest: Quantities of EpileptorRestingState available to monitor.
